unnormalised: Waste management is a pressing environmental challenge facing India today. With a population exceeding 1.4 billion and rapid urbanization, the volume of waste generated daily is substantial, placing immense strain on existing infrastructure and ecosystems. In cities like Mumbai and Delhi, overflowing landfills are a common sight.

unnormalised: Several initiatives are underway to improve waste management practices. The Swachh Bharat Mission, launched on 02/10/2014, aims to achieve a cleaner and healthier India through improved sanitation and waste management. Municipal corporations, like the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), are implementing source segregation programs, encouraging residents to separate biodegradable and non-biodegradable waste.
